channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Copa '71
channel.desc: Story of an extraordinary tournament, told through the voices of the women who took part.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Secrets of Skin
channel.desc: Professor Ben Garrod explores how some snakes can see using heat, how crocodiles feel through their jaws, and how some animals use electricity to navigate their world.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: War Walks
channel.desc: Richard Holmes traces the events of a night of the Blitz, from the sector control room where the incoming raiders were plotted through to the efforts to save St Paul's.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Albert Speer
channel.desc: Albert Speer was Hitler's architect, arms minister and only friend. But was his remorse after the war genuine, or a clever strategy.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Simon Schama's Power of Art
channel.desc: Mark Rothko believed that tradition was all used up and that figurative art could no longer connect us, viscerally, to the human tragedy. So he set himself - and New York - a test.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Today at the Test
channel.desc: Day one highlights from the second Test match between England and India.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
channel.desc: Historical series looking at the Roman Empire from the bottom up. Professor Mary Beard traces the story of several ordinary yet remarkable Roman citizens.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.desc: The day after London won the Olympic bid, terrorists attacked the transport network killing 52 people. 7/7: One Day in London gathers the testimony of over 50 people affected.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Frank McGuinness and Julie Nicholson Remember
channel.desc: A Song for Jenny. Frank McGuinness and Julie Nicholson look back on the 2015 drama that explored the impact of the 7/7 bombing at Edgware Road tube station.
